title: Game crashes at loading screen
body:
No matter what whether it is a custom game or pvp my client freezes at 7%. After a minute I can hear the in-game sounds. I tested it by typing messages to my team mates and I flashed to make sure. But the problem is graphically I am still in the loading screen. If I alt+tab out then back into the game my screen goes completely black.

I have booted into safe mode used a utility to completely uninstall my graphics card driver then reinstalled it and no luck it still happens.

I have gone through Riot's troubleshooting methods one by one and they did not solve the issue.

I have unchecked peer-to-peer and re-patched didn't work.

I have re-installed LoL and didn't work.

My Computer Specs:

Core i5 4690K (not overclocked)
AMD FirePro W5100
16 GB of RAM
240 GB SSD
Intel 7260 Dual Band AC Wifi Card (which gets ethernet speeds over wifi)

I have a business so I have the highest non-commercial Comcast internet package so I don't think its my internet or the speeds (usually at 86 mb/s down and 15 mb/s up). I live in Michigan so my ping is normally 20-ish.

I cannot think of a reason for this to happen and I have Google'd it far and wide with no results that have fixed this yet. Any help would seriously be appreciated.

replies.body:
Based on what you're saying (you're technically making it into game, but your PC is showing the loading screen), I'd venture to say that this is either a case of the network for some reason not sending information back to the client to say that you're "in-game" or potentially an esoteric hardware issue.

Since you've already completed the initial troubleshooting steps, go ahead and [submit us a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with [applicable logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs)).  I'd recommend including DirectX Diagnostic, R3D logs, and process list to start, though the team may ask you for others later.
I just submitted it. Thank you for the direction Box. Will post here some more if necessary.
